Reviews.Title: “Quiet Week in Branson”
Reviews.Author: LawnRanger69
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to this resort but the first time in the summer with all pools open. Our 2 bedroom deluxe is spacious and comfortable. We had requested a handicapped-accessible unit and found it very well set up for accessibility. We were in building 10 which is at the bottom portion of the property well away from the road. The building has a man-made bubbling brook between the buildings which makes it very relaxing to sit on the balcony. The property is maintained very well with our only complaint was the cold pool water. We also had a couple of families above us that could not walk softly at all. The resort should attempt to place families with children on the lower floors. The activities included breakfast and dinner shows on the property. We own at Wyndham and was very disappointed with the owner update. The representative used the relatively common practice of telling owners their accounts are not set up properly and then indicating he could help us if we would only purchase more points. Very disappointing approach that has become very common.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: Creese21
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Branson, and probably not our last. We chose to stay at the at the Wyndham based on reviews and on the overall look of the property. Please note, these condos are all for sale. For the most part, we thought the property was very good. The condo we were in was clean and had very little foot traffic in front of us. We had requested a quiet room and ... I think they did the best they could. There were two issues for us. First, the pool area is supposed to be non-smoking - the signs on the doors leading into the pools say no tobacco usage. Yet, they put smoking pots around the pool for smokers, which completely negates the sign. We had to leave the pool area one night because of all the smoking. Second, the walls and ceilings are paper thin. We were on the third floor and the room above was one of the sales showrooms. So, we heard a lot - I mean a lot - of foot traffic in the morning as they took people through the room. We ended up buying a fan to drown out the noise so it wouldn't wake us up. Ask for a high room. Also, remember, they sell condos here. So, you will be approached about getting tours and information. To avoid the daily phone calls, just unplug the phone when not in use - we didn't get one sales call our entire trip because of that. Again, overall, really liked the property and would stay there again. It is a little ways off the strip, but we preferred that compared to being on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “At times you need to be proactive”
Reviews.Author: blueshopper84
Reviews.Content: Being a Branson timeshare owner I have been to this resort many times. This time they "tried" to put us in a 2 bdrm deluxe unit in one of the older buildings. When I walked in the door I knew immediately that this was not going to work. The carpet was worn and frankly the room looked a little "dingy". I called and they did change the room back to the area where I knew the units were updated. We ended up getting a room with a nice golf course view and it was freshly painted and nicely updated.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: MaMa_C52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a 3 bedroom unit. The condo itself was extremely comfortable with great beds. Very roomy, decent shower, comfortable for a group. Few cracks in the tile, stove took forever to heat-all small things for overall comfort. However, one of the 2 hot tubs was not working. For as large as the place is I was surprised to find out they only had 2 hot tubs and then one was not working. When reported, the gal at the desk said it rained the day before and shrugged. Check in took over a half hour and whenever asked a question there was a real feeling of "I don't really care." Noisy with the people walking around upstairs but quit at a decent hour. Overall-great units-staff -not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed & pillows & Terrific pools, but annoying timeshare salespeople”
Reviews.Author: alr464
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with really comfortable beds & pillows, but the room was dusty & carpets were dirty, & it had bugs in kitchen. Maintenance came once to spray, again to catch a huge centipede in the bathroom and promised to spray again and give us a dinner coupon to compensate us for the inconvenience. They never sprayed and conveniently ALL managers were in a meeting when I tried to collect my coupon at the front desk. But the pools are great! The adult pool is so warm! Free movies available, tanning booth, Sauna, exercise room, and beautiful grounds. Unfortunately the timeshare sales people bring you a welcome gift which turns into a high pressure sales tactic. After two hours we walked out and the salesman followed us to our room, turned him down again, and he showed up at the pool where we were trying to relax. He actually knelt on the hot cement trying to show us papers at the pool edge! My husband finally told him "Not no but F*&^ no! Can I make it any plainer?" Just say no right off!

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: ksabl
Reviews.Content: Bad: We waited in a long line to check-in. Room not ready at check-in time. Waited another hour. Room had not been cleaned thoroughly. Phone calls related to problems produced no results. The only time I got results was when I complained in person to personnel at the check-in desk. We were assigned a room on the ground floor...signal power too low to get Internet connection. Good: 7 pools, massage

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: dmp1
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this resort. Had a 3 bedroom condo,third floor,yes you could hear the people upstairs when they were walking around. that is the only thing I can say bad about the place. The internet was fast and we had good T,V. reception

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family to stay.”
Reviews.Author: EdGaryN
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation to Branson. Made reservations at this Wyndham based on reviews. We were very happy with our stay here. We appreciated clean, updated accommodations. The staff was very friendly. We enjoyed spending time by the pool and playing some shuffleboard.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: 93Bert
Reviews.Content: Very clean, quiet rooms. Comfortable beds. Balconies. Great pricing. Modern, upscale. Recommend to older adults especially. Helpful staff. Timely responses for linen, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kyle H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of July with my entire immediate family (10 adults, 7 kids all under age 9). My wife and I have vacationed in Branson three times now and this was the first time we stayed off of the strip. Pros: The location of this property is fantastic, halfway between Tablerock and the strip. It is a bit farther from downtown Branson/Branson Landing. I much preferred staying in a condo to a hotel. The suites are quite nice and spacious. The beds are INCREDIBLE; so soft. The grounds are well maintained and picturesque. There are multiple swimming pools. The kiddie pool was perfect for our 3 and 1 year old children. Cons: Only one, but it was REALLY annoying....the time share sales staff. It's not what you think though. We did not take the tours, nor were we pressured to. There are NON-STOP tours throughout the day, with one of the stops being a model condo near our room. While inside our condo, we heard people talking all day long, outside on the sidewalk as they strolled by. The worst part was the door slamming with each sales rep entering and exiting (easily 200 times). Summary: A great way to do Branson!

Reviews.Title: “we won't be going back.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: Our accomodations were very nice, but our TV reception was absolutely horrible, the digitizing on the picture on ALL channels made it impossible to watch TV. I also left an expensive pair of capri pants on the luggage rack in the closet and didn't realize it until we got home. My mistake, I know that, but I called right then and asked if they had been turned in to lost and found. The lady that answered the phone took my information and said someone would call me. 2 days later I called back to find out the status, to be given the brush off again. I do know that either the maids didn't see them, which would mean they weren't doing their job, and the next guest took them, or the maids took them. Either way, isn't this disturbing?

Reviews.Title: “Aging Resort? Average for the area”
Reviews.Author: packratpatty
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a time share vacation for members, but they now allow anyone to purchase vouchers, stay one night, etc. The property is attractively landscaped but it is getting worn looking and there is no lighting in the pond/playground areas at night. I see that as a security/safety issue. That would have been beautiful at night IF you could see it. If you have a bigger vehicle, parking can be a little tricky. They were replacing large stair beams while we were there so be careful if you use the stairs at the ends of the complex buildings. Our first night we ran into problems. The bathtub was clogged and we had to call maintenance who arrived around 10PM. (There are no peepholes in the doors to see who is knocking on your door.) He pulled out tremendous amounts of black hair, which we had noticed in the back of the tub earlier. If housekeeping had done their job, they would have known the tub was stopped up (and he asked me to report it). He was extremely nice. Also, the lighting in the toilet/tub area is so dim, be careful if your going to shave your legs!!! The water pressure in the shower is not great, but the toilet will suck the walls in. LOL We noticed popcorn on the floor in the kitchen also, so I don't know how good a job housekeeping actually did except for making the bed and cleaning up the countertop areas which were VERY tiny in our unit. The bathroom vanity area lacks space if there are ANY women in your party. You really cannot cook in this unit even though there is a stove there. There is no prep space - maybe about one foot beetween the sink and stove. This was a unit for 4 people, but yet had only one couch in the living area. You would have to sit in a straight back kitchen chair to accomodate 4 people to watch tv. And you would have to pull the table to the middle of the living area if you wanted to seat 4 people around the table for eating/playing cards, etc. The table was really worn, which doesn't bother me, but if you are a resort you don't expect to see a table with unfinished areas, extreme scratches, etc., like it had been bought at a thrift store. The tv is not HD (doesn't bother me but does my husband) and the internet is soooooo slow I could get up and get dressed, put my make up on, come back and it still hasn't moved. We were there for 3 full days and struggled with understanding the wall switches for the lights. The last day I gently (I do mean gently) tugged on the overhead fan and the entire pull came out from the top of the fan, not just the snap chain. That could happen anywhere though. We heard just about everything that went on next door. We could smell their food coming through the adjoining door. I know when THEY ate popcorn. I knew if the kids wanted jelly on their toast, when they played/jumped on the beds, when they fought, when Dad talked to Mom, etc. And the AC was in our unit (apparently for both of the units) and was very loud everytime it came on. On the plus sides, the bed was very comfortable, there was a tv high on the wall in the bedroom (for a total of 2 tvs), and if you don't answer the phone they won't pester you for timeshare spills. The little bit of staff we dealt with, were nice.We can't really complain since our time there was given to us by a friend for our anniversary, but I do feel that the people that own timeshare there and others visiting need to be aware that this is an aging facitily. However, all of this said, the facility itself is probably better than a lot of the motels/hotels in the area, but I don't know about the price.

Reviews.Title: “All of the Comforts of Home”
Reviews.Author: WandaMaria
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Meadows was a good one. Our room was clean and had all of the comforts of home including a little kitchen complete with refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher, coffee pot and a washer/dryer. The room was quite spacious and very comfortable. As we had several family members with us, it was nice for all of us to be able to gather in our room to eat breakfast before heading into town for a day of enjoyment. The pool and jacuzzi were quite nice, as well. We swam in the evening to relax after being out all day. There were quite a few people and kids out at the pool until late in the evening. The pool closes at 11:00, but I kind of wished they had an earlier curfew for kids. It's tough to relax when you are being splashed by rowdy kids when you just want to relax and converse with others at the pool. All in all, though, I enjoyed our visit and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: RtripKearney
Reviews.Content: Our daughter's family booked a week at this condo during the July 4 holiday. Though it was crowded, as most of Branson was on July 4, we had a great time. Our lower level condo was clean, close to the pools and main office, guest services, and larger pool areas. It was a little noisy since we were on the bottom leve. We had a small incident with an eager young basketball player above us at about 1 in the morning, but other than that, it was a comfortable unit. The unit was $900 per week which was Wyndham members rate. Well worth that. It was less than 5 minutes to downtown and most of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot to stay for a week”
Reviews.Author: RandyRoss
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of June in a one bedroom deluxe at the Wyndham Branson at the Meadows. The room was very comfortable, quiet and spacious. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. On arrival, we asked for a recommendation regarding a place to eat and were directed to Dana's Bar B Que (just down the road). This was an excellent choice for good but inexpensive food. The resort also provided us with locations of local grocery stores (very useful information). We were NOT pressured to sit through a presentation of any kind. We were looking for some things to do other than show and were directed to Dogwood Canyon, where we spent an excellent day (take the tram when you visit) enjoying nature. We also received some good advice about what to see and what not to see, regarding local shows. We attended the Wednesday breakfast show and one of the evening shows and found both to be entertaining and of excellent value. This resort was not quite as upscale as some Wyndham resorts we have stayed at and you will definitely want to leave the resort if you are planning to stay for more than a couple of days (there is not a lot to hold one too long). However, it was very comfortable and a great location for seeing Branson and area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: M1436
Reviews.Content: The units overall were very nice and very spacious (we had a 2 bedroom unit). A few complaints; the internet didnt work the entire week we were there, not sure if this is common or just an issue when we were there. Also, when we first walked in the room, the tile floors were very dirty (food, hairs, ect.). We had the cleaning staff come back up, which they did right away, and clean the floor which was then fine. The grounds of the resort, including the pools, were excellent. We have two young kids and there was definitely plenty for them to do. They also have quite time starting at 11 which means the pool closed which was nice as well. Overall the unit was very spacious and we did do two meals a day in our unit and the kitchen was fine for a week. The decor is somewhat updated and outside the floors, the room was in very good shape when we got in. Lastly, the staff was very nice and friendly during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just like Home”
Reviews.Author: Randall B
Reviews.Content: Wyndham in the Meadows is a wonderful resort that is family friendly. We have stayed there many times and everytime we fall in love with it more. All 1, 2, and 3 bedroom deluxe suites are just like being at home. Large rooms, kitchen, w/d, just like home.

Reviews.Title: “A great place with an even better staff”
Reviews.Author: mike4418
Reviews.Content: This is a Wyndham managed property and as always a well run professional establishment. While not brand new and showing minor signs of wear and tear it is very well kept. The location is wonderful. The staff is fantastic they helped us with show tickets as well as finding local resturants. We most certainly will go back. The folks in Branson are very friendly no matter where you go. I understand why they call this he heart of America.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay there were only a few things that bothered us.”
Reviews.Author: burdick
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent. Everything was clean and up to date. The staff was nice. The activities on the grounds were good, expecially for kids. It wasn't in a bad location. The things we didn't like were that they only had one bar-b-q pit in our area and it was tiny and had no lid and it wasn't for grilling burgers. It was placed under a low tree, which I thought was unsafe. Also, the main kids pool in our area was closed for a day, but the indoor pool was open. The kid activities were good, but it was a bit pricey. Expecially if you have more than one child. It cost me $24 for two activities for one child. I do also think their should've been a seperate place for sales people to show rooms other than where we were staying. It made for us seeing sales people all day everyday. The only elevator on our building was constantly packed with sales people. Also, we didn't like that we had to wash our own towels along with our clothes in the tiny washer they had in our unit. With five people the washer stayed running. But overall, the experience was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: JoyceeKelley
Reviews.Content: Tomorrow, we are checking out after a week at the Branson Meadows. This has been a lovely trip. The people here at the resort have been friendly and helpful. Our two bedroom suite in 460 was perfect for the four of us. We have a beautiful view off of our balcony, overlooking a babbling brook. Our beds were comfortable. We had everything we needed. When we called for extra paper towels and dish soap, they were delivered in approximately 20 minutes. We enjoyed the Wednesday breakfast with local talent. We even got to meet Greg Brady from the Brady Bunch at breakfast. Having a washer and dryer is wonderful. We are going home with clean clothes. Everything has been in good working order. The grounds are beautiful. We were on the fourth floor and it was quiet. We always had convenient parking. We have had a wonderful visit to Branson, Missouri. It has been relaxing and we would certainly return. Thank you Concierge, Jeanine, for booking all of our shows. That was very helpful since this was our first trip to Branson and we are from Arizona. Thank you, to Gail for the golf cart ride and showing us the way to the scenic view point. We made that trip the next day... and it was as pretty as you said. You gave us great directions and a lot of good information. Thank you to others who stopped us each day and made sure we had what we needed. Missouri people are the friendliest people!

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Meadows”
Reviews.Author: jeb45
Reviews.Content: The Meadows is a very nice complex located away from the strip but still convenient to all the attractions. The facilities are very nice and enjoyable. The resort staff and workers were very nice and courteous on all matters. I would highly recommend this property to anyone planning on the Branson area. Be very cautious with the sales staff. The preview on the shows held each week for the guests is excellent and a real asset. Check out the old part of town, it is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin N
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several resorts and I always love Wyndhams! I have stayed at the Branson Meadows twice. Both times I had an excellent time. The rooms are clean and spacious. The stream that runs through the property is pretty. The pools are great! The only complaint that I have is that there was not a pantry in kitchen for groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michael V
Reviews.Content: This resort location is relatively new and beyond a great room that was extremely well cleaned and furnished, the outdoor pool and hottubs were spendidly relaxing. If there was anything negative at all it would have been that the games provided like table tenis, did not provide paddles and balls to play with and there was nobody around the game area to ask about them. Other than that, everyone was very helpful and curteous. I would definately stay here again the next time I am in Branson, Missouri.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and amenities. Kind of far from the strip.”
Reviews.Author: wjdp
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed The Meadows. We had a three bedroom, three bathroom unit and it was perfect for our family of six. The kids loved the pool area and we went night swimming almost every night. The resort was clean and well maintained; everything seemed brand new. We will return to this property next time we are in Brason!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DuaneHaas
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very nice sized. We loved the king sized bed. I am personally not a fan of feather pillows, but they were tolerable. Water pressure in the room was pretty bad. The tv in the bedroom was easy to watch on the wall on the end of the bed. The sales people called a couple of times a day to take a tour, but we just ended up ignoring the calls. Close to the lake, but the shops and food were a bit of a drive each time. Overall we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michiganmama72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Branson at the Meadows from April 1, 2012 - April 8, 2012. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 8 occupancy condo thru RCI. We traveled with our 2 young children and friends who stayed in a different room. Our room in Building 300 was on the 1st floor. Quite spacious and comfortable. There were plenty of ammenities, in-room laundry facilites, all small appliances (blender, etc.), pool towels, etc. Everything was clean, and in good condition except for our coffee maker. The entire side of the coffeemaker was cracked so all the water seeped out the side. We called the desk and the staff responded with a new maker within 10 minutes. The resort is huge with 5 outdoor pools and an indoor pool. Although the outdoor pool were not suppose to be open until May, they did open the main outdoor pool early so our kids were able to enjoy it during the hot days which was nice. Several of the hot tubs were open as well. There was always a running shuttle to which you could ride from the recreation building to your room, etc. The only negative thing I would mention (and it really isnt a big deal) is there is absolutely NO cupboard space to store any groceries. All the cupboards contain dishes and appliances so it was a little difficult storing items.

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYED THE DINNER SHOW!”
Reviews.Author: KDYE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Meadows the week of April 1. The town has some damage but not too bad. The resort was nice! They offered a dinner and show at a reasonable cost at the resort. The show was very good and the food was ok. Too cold for the outdoor pools but they have plenty when weather is warm! It was just a great place to relax! I was rather happy at this resort the cushions actually stayed on the couch. Most of the Wyndham Resorts we have stayed you were not able to keep cushions on the couch. The staff was very pleasant! The kids enjoyed the indoor pool, played shuffle board, and basketball.

Reviews.Title: “An unmatched accommodations in the Branson, MO area”
Reviews.Author: dle031238
Reviews.Content: My wife, her brother and sister-in-law, and I checked into the Wyndham Branson at the Meadows on Sunday, March 25th for a week's vacation through RCI's Extra Vacation. We had a wonderful top floor (4th) two bedroom unit overlooking the lagoon, the two fountains, a covey of ducks, the swimming pool and the spa, had adequate parking, and an elevator to all floors in the building #9. The unit was spacious, comfortable, and accessible for my partially handicapped wife. This was our second stay there, the first being in 2009. The entertainment capitol of the US is certainly Branson, MO. Donald L Ensenbach

Reviews.Title: “As enjoyable as you want it to be!”
Reviews.Author: gstimis
Reviews.Content: We have vacationed at Wyndham Branson at the Meadows for the last 3 years. It is beautifully maintained and well equipped. I've never felt "obligated" to attend the time share presentations. Most recently, we were close to the adult pool and a wonderful waterfall. The resort is located a couple of miles off 76 Blvd., Branson's main drag, which makes it easy to access. Branson has designated several routes that allow you to avoid the traffic and you can easily do so from Wyndham Branson at the Meadows. Among planned activities, should you be so inclined, is a Branson "'sampler." 10-12 acts from Branson shows do a song or two from their shows. A meal is included and the price is very reasonable. We loved the show and actually chose to attend 2-3 of the full shows. Pointe Royale Golf Course is located next door to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not a restful weekend”
Reviews.Author: dbKansas
Reviews.Content: Excellent front desk service, nice accommodations, beds very comfortable, They now have internet in the room, BUT, if you want to ruin your vacation let someone from member services come with their coupon book and survey. Bill was VERY rude. Some say The meadows is in a bad loacation, No, its very handy to the yellow and red routes that will get you away from the strip. They even helped with noisy, rude upstairs occupants at 11 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Comfortable Condos”
Reviews.Author: Diane D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Branson at the Falls the week prior to Christmas in 2011. The staff was friendly and accomodating. I couldn't begin to say enough about their outstanding and professional service. The condo I stayed in was warm and quiet. I enjoyed cooking in the fully equipped kitchen and use of the stacked washer and dryer. The furniture and applicances were all up to date. I enjoyed some of the activities offered in the recreation center. They always have numerous events and activities, including meals available. My stay at this property was an absolute joy!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: BigWash
Reviews.Content: OK.. This was the last stay of our 30 day trip.. I must say that I had never heard of Branson and really felt like I was taking a chance travelling there in JAN. Let me tell you... I am glad that we took the chance and went to Branson.. The staff is absolutely outstanding. They cater to your every need. I called and asked them (in advance) for a renovated room. I was told if they could accommodate me, they would.. Well, they are true to their word. We had an absolute wonderful two bedroom suite in BLDG 455. It overlooked the lake and the pool. Our room was outstanding. The beds were comfortable, with flatscreen tvs in each room.. I am a coffee drinker. So, when I ran out of the coffee that was initially provided, they gave me more. The staff there are absolutely outstanding.. Two that I would say stand out are Christopher (checked me in) and Patty (gave outstanding directions for family events in town). They were great! If you are in Branson, the Meadows is where you want to be! We are returning in March to relive the experience all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Condos in Branson”
Reviews.Author: ColesDad1
Reviews.Content: I've been to branson more than 20 times and when I need a condo I stay here.I've stayed in 1,2 and 3 beadroom condos.They are well kept up and allow you plenty of room.Check in can take some time if they are busy but that happens at all places.Outdoor pools and hot tubs are great in warmer weather.There is a indoor pool and my son and enjoy it in cooler weather.Any problems have always been taken care of fast.I've stayed at other condos nearby and will not make that mistake again.Most are poorly buildt and not well kept up.There are plenty of places to eat nearby so you won't starve.Take 265 via 65 thru table rock dam to falls creek road and you will bypass crazy hwy 76.You can also go the back way to silverdollar city from these condos.I'll be back spring break 2012,already have my reservation!

Reviews.Title: “branson at the meadows”
Reviews.Author: emerson b
Reviews.Content: there was hair in the bathtubs. the sheets had stains on them. the parking was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the accomodations, the staff not so much...”
Reviews.Author: With5KidsInTow
Reviews.Content: Here's the bottom line, the accommodations were fantastic, roomy, clean, nicely decorated. I'd absolutely stay in A DIFFERENT Wyndham property again. If you've been in a Wyndham condo before, it's exactly as you'd expect, which in my opinion, is a great thing. Our family of 7 fit perfectly in the 2 bedroom condo. Now, onto my negative part of the review--the staff. We had reservations for a Wed-Sat stay, then another night on Sunday. Basically, we were missing the Saturday night part of our stay in Branson. Upon check in I asked to have that night added to our trip. They couldn't do that. Apparently, there's a number you must call for reservations, the desk-workers can't make reservations. But, she did say she'd ask her supervisor (in the office directly behind check-in) who didn't have the courtesy to come speak with me, only told the desk-worker "no". I said, fine, please call so I can add the additional night. The call was horrendous. Basically, no customre service. They only add nights with a 2 or more night stay (ummm...I stayed with 3 night on the forward side of this reservation and an addition might behind it???) and could only give me the room if I paid for 2 nights-almost $400. All this in a military "friendly" town. This was our last family vacation before my husband deploys for Afghanistan and the hotel couldn't give us the missing night we needed, even though there was vacancy. Couldn't have been less impressed with this staff. The pool was tiny and no indoor hot tub, other than that, loved the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!!!!!! STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: 220smd220
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2- 1 bdrm deluxe condo's. At check in they told us they had to charge a $100 deposit to a credit card for each condo that they would later refund if there was no damage. I have never heard of a place charging your card $200 and then refunding you 7-10 days after you check out. Normally most places just take your credit card and then will charge you if there is damage. Just a way for them to make interest on your money. The check in was incredibly slow and I kept having to repeat information as they kept getting our name mispelled. I specifically requested when we reserved the condo's to have them close together as I have 4 children that we had to split up. The closest they could get us was in the same building but on seperate floors. Once we arrived at the condo we found the condo was very musty, dirty with bugs in the tub, bathroom sink was clogged, and a/c was not working at all. I called the front desk at 4:30 and they were going to send maintenance up to look at it. We waited and waited and finally called the front desk two more times and it was not until 11:00 pm that maintenance finally showed up to look at the a/c. Maintenance guy said he could not fix a/c and would have to send a/c technician out tomorrow to fix. It was 80 degree's already in the condo and smelled musty. Front desk did offer to move us 1/2 mile down the road to another condo, but only had one condo available. That obviously would not work since we could not be that far apart from our other kids. Needless to say we did not sleep much the first night. I actually contemplated sleeping in the car as it was so musty smelling. Second day a/c tech did come out and fix the a/c. Sink never did get fixed. That night we went to a show and arrived back at the condo around 10:30 and found no parking at all. We were told by security that they were parking guests at the welcome center and a shuttle would take guests to their condo. It was pouring rain that night and we had to park several blocks away from our condo and take turns being shuttled by a golf cart in the rain at night back to our condo. The next morning my husband walked the several blocks to go get our car and bring it down to our condo so we could load our luggage. However, he found that the resort shuttles were all parked behind our car and had to wait over 30 minutes for them to be moved in order for us to get our car out. We complained numerous times to the manager Becky Guthry but she could care less since we were not owners at this resort and they already had our money. This was the worst experience at a resort we have ever had. Motel 6 would have been nicer than this place!! This resort is old, run down and does not care about it's customers at all. It is also in a very inconvenient remote location. Please do not waste your money here. There are so many other nicer resorts that care about their guests. I would suggest paying $30 more and staying at the Marriott condo's which are no comparison to these and in a much more convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “These Folks are Trying”
Reviews.Author: bobemac
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in a one bedroom unit. These units are about 20 years old, and of wooden frame construction, poor sound insulation. The sounds made in these units does carry. The resort itself seem a little tired, though all the employees were friendly and helpful. The negatives that stood out; A strange foul odor throughout. Very low water pressure in the shower. Limited pantry space with large kitchen. Pool and hot tub drained with temperatures in the 80s. Cheap motel quality towels. Fitness equipment was out-dated. No access to fitness without separate key you signed for daily. Internet Access had to be re-keyed daily. No housekeeping mid-week. Added towels had another charge. "Members Library" had less than 30 books, but nobody knew where it was located. Located on the outskirts of Branson. Nice landscaping. A good selection of resort activities, but there's so much to do off property we did not participate. The king bed was comfy, but most of the furnishings were boringly neutral. The TVs were flat screen, but the picture was very dim, even for SD. Our AC stopped working the first evening. John the maintenance man contacted the local contract repair company and the unit was repaired within two hours.

Reviews.Title: “Branson at the Meadows”
Reviews.Author: PEEWRO
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were surprised that the usually very well kept units were so NOT. The windows to the patio area were absolutely FILTHY. With the sun filtering thru it made it even worse. We called housekeeping about this and some bulbs that were burned out and in the 5 days we were here, the problems were never resolved. The grounds on the other hand were beautiful!! Would have been a great trip if only they would have followed thru on our requests for lighting and clean windows. The best part or the whole trip was the shuttle driver who turned us on to the Scenic Overlook, The College of The Ozarks and The Chateau On The Lake. He was definately the gem of the whole vacation!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Wyndham at The Meadows”
Reviews.Author: billfedwards
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in a 2bdrm dlx and I couldn't find one thing to fuss about. The propertwas nice, the rooms were clean and comfy and the staff did not even mention going to a time share presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: lovesthewater33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 31-August 7th. We had an excellent experience at this resort! We had a 1 bedroom deluxe with a full kitchen. Rooms where very clean. They looked like they had just been remodeled. Very large spacious 1 bedroom units. We had 2 teenage boys with us and we never felt cramped our overcrowded. Pools are small but very enjoyable. Staff was very friendly and very helpful. It was a very HOT week in Branson and our a/c kept the room nice and cold. I have stayed at Still Waters in Branson before and I would say this resort is as nice as that. The location is good also. Not to far away from the strip or the lake. Overall I would recommended staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: HarvestMoon
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of two bedroom units and a one bedroom unit. All were nice and comfortable. Check in and check out was easy. The people that worked there were helpful above and aboard whenever we had any questions. The pools were nice and there were other activities that we didn't take part in but it looks like there was plenty to do. It is easy access to the rest of Branson. The only complaint was the WiFi. Yes, it's free, but it's very spotty. It would work in one unit but not in another and it would work for awhile and then slow down to a crawl so that it was unusable. If you are very dependent on the internet, you may be disappointed. Unfortunately, when we called ahead, they said the WiFi was working but that was kind of a stretch. They really need to get that fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Meadows and we'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: wereontheroadagain
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weeks vacation at the Meadows and it was great!! Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly staff and complimentary cookies and lemonade. The nicest lady named Rhonda checked us in, and she was most helpful. They gave us our parking pass, map of the property, and we were good to go. I was happy that we got a unit on the bottom floor. I believe there are four levels to each building. If you do get an upper level, there are elevators..... which makes it more convienient! Our particular condo was a newly remodeled one bedroom king deluxe which features a large entry, an open floor plan, a fully equipted kitchen and large living area. The sofa pulls out to a bed if you need the extra sleeping space. There are large flat screen tv's in each living room and bedroom, and a dvd player in each living room. The bedroom os nice size with a comfy king size bed with fluffy pillows. It had three deep drawers for clothes and a closet with hangers. The bathroom has a vanity with a sink and a large jet tub. Then it has another adjoining room with a shower, sink, and toilet. The only negative thing I would say is that I found a couple of hairs in the bathroom area, and the shower could have been a little cleaner. ) : The kitchen has everything you could possibly need to cook with. I was in question about that knowing that we would cook alot. It has a blender,beaters,coffee pot, pots, pans, mixing bowls,cookie sheet, utinsels, dishes, cups, glasses,silverware......the works!!! Silverware and dishes are for four. We are a family of five, so a lockoff worked the best for us. The adjoining condo had the exact same amenities, only a smaller scale. The bed was king size...the the rooms are all smaller. Each condo has a washer and dryer, but they are the apartment size ones. They didn't hold very much laundry per load, thus it took a while to dry. There is detergent provided as well as dishwasing detergent. Our condo looked out to a beautiful pond with a fountain, and a bridge. The pool and kiddy pool was a very short walk from our room. There is also a playground for the kids next to the kiddy pool. There are places to grill as well as a picnic area if you wanted to take your barbeque outside. We never played, but there is a shuffle board next to the activities center as well as a basketball court. The grounds are well taken care of and very beautiful!!! There are shade trees all around the buildings that helps keep you out of the hot sun in the summer. ( : The location is about two minutes from the Dam and Tablerock Lake. It is about a 5 to 10 min drive to the main strip depending on the traffic. What more can I say about the Meadows? It was a very pleasant stay, and very relaxing!!!! We will definately be back as soon as we can!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great place!”
Reviews.Author: jdunna
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have had a better experience! When you're tired of shopping or Silver Dollar City, go back "home" and get in the jaccuzi or whirlpool tub and relax. Fully equipped, clean and beautiful! Easy to get to and right in the heart of any direction you want to go for shopping, entertainment, fishing, boating, etc. Buy your ticket from the office at a discount, concierge, workout room, many pools, all clean and very nice! Perfect for family vacations!

Reviews.Title: “Why don't you allow dogs?”
Reviews.Author: starrsnip
Reviews.Content: We let my parents stay here due to the fact that we have a small dog that travels with us everywhere we go. My parents loved the condo--it was very clean, fitted with everything you need, even a new oster blender! The grounds were kept up so much that they reminded me of Disney World. Again, the 9 point rating was because dogs are not allowed here. I could never buy a time share because of that because a dog will always be a big part of my husband and my lives. Why not simply charge people for any destruction a dog may cause? If they are irresponsible dog owners that is what should happen. All of us who crate train our dogs, teach them not to bark all day, make frequent trips back to the room to take doggy for walks, pick up with baggies anything they leave behind are actually punished for the few slobs out there who don't need to own a dog anyway! Please consider changing this and my husband and I would very seriously consider purchasing a time share.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 6-7 times summer/winter. Beautiful setting, Close but away from the madness.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGal16
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place to stay in Branson. It is close to the Strip for activities but close to all the "short cuts:" to get around the traffic. Wonderful place to walk day and night and the pools are set next to a wooded and flower lined large pond. The staff has been most helpful whether assisting with gear when I travel alone with two toddlers or offering friendly tips or advice. I would never have a problem recommending the Meadows.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - All Renovated and New - Ooh La La”
Reviews.Author: KrisInOmaha
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before, and it was always nice, but now it's been renovated and it's extra-nice. Flatscreen TVs in every room, new mattresses, updated and new furniture, paint, and kitchenware. Everything is so clean, clean, clean. The only that has not changed is how nice the staff is. They even arranged to have bellman take our luggage to our condominium. We would never stay anywhere else, these condominums are HUGE, Beautiful, and the recreation center is Awesome! We will "definitely" stay here again. Thank you Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean and Outdated”
Reviews.Author: ApleAnnie
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Wyndham Branson at the Meadows and totally disappointed. The layout was great but it is very obvious that this is an old building and needs updating. The tile on the bathroom floor were loose....grouting pieces stuck to our feet when we got out of the shower. The top of the shower frame was broken, couldn't shut the shower door!! The bathroom mirrow hadn't been cleaned and was splattered with toothpaste or shaving cream. Top of the stove was greasy and the worst part was there was hair in the shower when we went to shower. Our building had some offices down below and outside the offices was where the sales people smoked. So when you went to leave each time...you had the pleasure of walking through their cloud of smoke to get to your car! To say we were disappointed....is putting it mildly. The one good thing, the bed was good and the place was quiet. The morning that we left....there wasn't one other car in our parking lot!! Think we know why!!

Reviews.Title: “Generally, very good”
Reviews.Author: harold42330
Reviews.Content: Overall, the site is very well maintained. The staff are friendly and helpful, except for member services. No truth in some of them. Not helpful at all. They make promisses, but do not follow through with them. Management really should look in to this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rest”
Reviews.Author: my sweet
Reviews.Content: We had a great room to rest in. It was close to all the activities. I would suggest you ask for a top floor. There are elevators so you do not need to be concerned about climbing stairs. The staff was wonderful. The only problem was the indoor pool is small and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Family Vacation 2009”
Reviews.Author: lhoweth
Reviews.Content: The Resort was great but we happened to have the hottest week ever in June. Grounds of the hotel were great and we had lots of room in the two bedroom unit we were in.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for families!”
Reviews.Author: OKCowgirl
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort for Branson, MO. It is a beautiful place, the condo was 2 bedroom, 2 bath, very spacious and in excellent condition. There were several pools of a good size, kiddie pool and play area. The parking can be difficult at night, but they offer rides in golf carts - it was great! It is also easy to access the west side of Branson without having to go on the strip - Silver dollar city, White Water, even a Segway park!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thought we were staying at the Meadows - boy we were wrong!”
Reviews.Author: jennlynnmahan80
Reviews.Content: We have booked though a 3rd party twice before and ended up both times at the Branson Meadows - a very nice resort. I was surprised when we went to check and had found out that since we were not RCI members they had moved us to the Falls. First question since I have young children and it had been cold - "is there an indoor pool?" - nope, but feel free to drive down the road and use a different pool. Next question - "is there an elevator?" nope - you have to use the stairs. Does anyone know what kind of nightmare this is for 2 1/2 year old children who are very independent? The outside of the condo looked very nice, but you could tell once we got inside that this section was no where as nice as the Meadows. The real problem came the first night. My husband and I woke up the first morning both with sore back from the hard bed. Now we aren't particular about beds but when we both wake up sore there is a problem. I proceeded to sleep the next three nights on the couch. Talk about a great vacation! We ended up leaving 3 days early mainly due to the bed situation. We couldn't handle it anymore. The lady noticed we were leaving early when I checked out and I told her why. Come on people - invest in some nice beds!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: robsdaman
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful and comes with everything you need for your vacation. The service is excellent. We loved everything about this place. It is far enough away from the strip to stay quiet yet close enough to get there quickly. Highly recommended for your next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Where do i start? Not what we expected !!!”
Reviews.Author: kcbuggy
Reviews.Content: Lets start out by saying it was our 8th Anniversary and was looking forward to a week away. SO where do i start? The bed was the worst matress i have ever slept on, after examining the matress i noticed it didnt match the box springs so that may be a sign in a cheap replacement. There was not a hot tub at the resort but they were so nice to have a tram that would drive you 2 miles away to one at another resort (much needed after a night on the rock bed). I prefer one onsite within walking distance but to some people it wouldnt matter. We got back to the resort Sat night and there was not a single parking space so we called the front deck and ask what to do, they sent security and the nice lady that came said its an ongoing problem and no one seems to care so just park in the No Parking Zone-(the" towed a owners expense" sign worried me a little) so i went to bed with my fingers crossed and she was right the car was still there in the morning. Overall the room was nice and clean, I would have thought they would have opt for a tv bigger then 19" but hey i was on vacation and wasnt there to watch tv - so as long as it told me the weather i was fine. Once you climbed into the rock bed and turned off the light you was welcomed with the nice bright glow of the outside hall lighting but that wasnt a big deal to me but to some it may be a problem if you like it dark. We were lucky enough to have good neighbors that was gone alot but if they had there tv on or they were talking- we herd it. The walls are very thin and if you got stuck next to the wrong people it would be a mojor problem. We checked in on Friday and ened up leaving on Monday and surrended our other 4 nights due to the fact we just couldnt deal with the bed situation and would rather just pay for a different room where we could sleep. I have stayed at many Wyndham resorts and will more then likely stay in many more but this one is NOT what we normally get, we were thinking maybe this area was newly purchased as an addition to the main resort and they havent got threw the growing pains of it yet- you check in about 2 miles down the road at the main resort and that is where everything is at so it makes since that this was an afterthough. WE SURE HOPE SO! Hope this helps - pls note everyone has a dif expectations and some may thank it is the greatest place ever and some may feel like we did but nomally we are easy to pls but just had some bad luck on this stay-

Reviews.Title: “The Wyndham was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Lazertaggirl
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham was wonderful! The most excellent place I've stayed. The pullout couch was comfy, and there was a king sized bed. Though the pool facilities were crowded, they were still fun to get in. There were 47 people in the pool I went to at night. i loved the kitchen, and that the TV in the bedroom was as big as the one in the living room. When I come back to Branson, I want to stay at the Wyndham again!! Lazer tag girl

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for family!”
Reviews.Author: four_j
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay here at the Wyndham Meadows. First, our room was very clean. And, we found the staff to be very helpful. Whenever we ran out of something, they were quick to bring it to the room. Our room was also quiet, which was especially nice for napping children. We were originally worried about it being too far off the strip, but it is nice and close to everything in Branson, which was great. Honestly, after going there, I'm pretty sure that I wouldn't want to stay on the strip. The pools were clean, as well as the playground. It was especially nice having a washer and dryer in the room. This room was booked using of Hotwire; however, I think you can get a better deal with the AAA rate or booking directly. If you are looking for a family friendly place with a nice amount of space, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: pacerzfan
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time here. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Rooms were nice sized and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just booked third vacation here!”
Reviews.Author: jennlynnmahan80
Reviews.Content: I just booked our third week long trip here for September 2009. We stayed at the Wyndham Branson at the Meadows in May 2008 and then again in November 2008. Let me first say that we are not RCI members, but I purchased the week stays through an unrelated online auction site. We were more than pleased both times we stayed, which I guess is obvious since we have booked another trip. My twins were a little more than a year old the first time we stayed. It was great to have a condo where they had a room for naps and we could still watch t.v. without disturbing them. That never would have happened in a hotel room. Both times we were there it was two cold for the outdoor pools to be open, but they looked very nice. We took advantage of the indoor pool several times during our stay. They do have a hot tub, but it is located outside. That was one thing that I wish they would change. It would be great to be able to enjoy the hot tub during the winter months. The kitchens were very nice. It allowed us to eat breakfast and sometimes lunch there instead of being out the expense of eating out the whole time. Overall, we were very pleased with the grounds. We took several walks outside to look at the ducks in the pond and of course play on the playground. My favorite part of the stay was the jaccuzzi tub in the master bedroom. I took advantage of the tub almost every day of our stay! I was also pleased to find a tanning bed and game room on the grounds. The tanning bed was a little expensive, but gave me a great way to relax while my husband and children were napping. On a couple of occassions, I also visited the internet room - where they have three computers and printers set up. It was a great way to research a couple of things while we were there. I have been to Branson many times in my lifetime and think it is a great little family vacation spot. We look forward to our upcoming trip to the Branson at the Meadows and are hoping to be able to use the outdoor pools this time!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ilovecincy
Reviews.Content: First off there are multiple owners/companies at this location. We booked through an owners website apperently (we thought it was Wyndham) and when we arrived there were problems and the Wyndham workers on the property said they could do nothing about it. We thought we were booking a nice Wyndham condo but we got an 1980's condo with no elevators for my son who has spina bifida. He had to walk up steps everywhere on the property. Somehow they got around the ADA even for the new areas on site. The condo was clean but had no remodling done since I was born! And it was over $200 a night. Would not recommend this property for the money. We usually stay at Marriott properties and would have in Branson but the Horizons was booked so we thought we would take a chance on another brand but would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: NJMomMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just returned from a week at this Wyndham Branson Meadows. We had a one bedroom unit on the top floor at the far end of the building. Excellent location with beautiful sweeping view of the mtns and valley. We didn't have lots of people walking by as we might have if we were in the middle of the building. Our unit however was not sparkling clean! It was acceptable, but not perfect. There were some broken cookies between the stove and refrig that had not been cleaned. The bathroom shower faucets, backplates were spotted (not wiped clean). The carpet had a couple of noticeable spots. Otherwise the unit was clean. We did notice a few tiny tiny ants, called maintainance, they came immediately, sprayed....and that was the end of it. We were impressed with the prompt service. Our unit had a connecting but locked door to another unit and noise from that unit was extrememly noticeable. Again we were lucky that it was not a problem...the noise we heard was brief and at reasonable hours. The resort was very welcoming upon our arrival...friendly helpful staff. They run little shuttle trams around the resort which we didn't use by others did. There are multiple pools.at the resort, some larger, some kiddee. We were lucky to be nearest to an adult only pool. It was small but pleasant. Relatively clean, but not sparkling. The activity building has a large indoor pool, sauna, massage, exercise room, game room, and location to buy show tickets. Again very helpful people. Also on site, in the check-in building, are 3 computers for guest use. We were always able to get on the computers. We would recommend the resort replace the beds at least in our unit. The matresses were thin and not very comfortable. Other than that we would certainly stay there again....and would request the building we were in. Some of the other buildings are close together and not as well located. But ours was fine! Hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “A HOT TIME IN BRANSON”
Reviews.Author: clarabellekennedy
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for this resort as it was to be a family vacation, with children coming in from across the country. It was booked thru RCI and promised to be a Gold Crown property. Through no fault of Wyndham, we could not have picked a worse week to visit Branson--the temperatures were in the low 100s every day-Whew! However, when we checked in, we were told that one of our children and family would be right next door to us-actually one was above us on another floor, and one several doors down. It worked out well, but interesting that the resort had promised one thing which turned out not to be. Upon arriving and during unloading his luggage, our son locked his car and room keys in his running car(his mistake). As he was waiting for AAA he found a coat hanger and tried in vain to unlock the car. As this was happening, his wife was sitting outside (extremely hot!) and noticed at least 2 motel personnel drive by in their golf carts--no one stopped to ask if they could assist them in any way. We find this unacceptable by any stretch of the imagination. Our daughter, upon checking in, found a very dirty kitchen floor with black footprints-since they have a one year old who spends lots of time on the floor, they called housekeeping and a gal was there right away, and hand mopped the floor--housekeeping and maintenance were always spot on. (We know, since we kept them rather busy)! Our first problem came when the light cover in our shower fell down!! Thank heavens we were not in the shower at the time! Imagine our surprise!! We then went to visit our daughter and family, and found that the light cover in their shower had also fallen down, and just missed their teenage daughter. Our son-in-law put it back up, and then the shower door fell out of its tracks! The day before we left, their cover fell again. The showers are poorly equipped for an older or physically handicapped person, as there is nowhere to put shampoo, gel, etc. save for a tiny place which held a small bar of soap. Our son had to call maintenance for a garbage disposal that would not work, and our daughter, as well as my husband and I had to call for help as we were getting very little air conditioning in our units--both conditioners in each unit were found to be not working properly because of filters inside which were clogged with dirt. After replacing those, the air conditioning worked properly. Our feeling is that all units should have WIFI, or at least connections to the internet--in this day and age, many of us travel with our computers to, at the very least, check our email, and print our return boarding passes. The Meadows has a small room with two computers, no word-processing software attached, and 15 minute limits for use. This included children who were playing computer games and unsupervised by parents. The day before we left, our son-in-law went to print our boarding passes, and found the printer to be broken. He went to the front desk and asked the clerk if she would print the boarding passes--she said she could not do it. He then went to the manager and asked if she would print them, which she did. One last problem--we were housed in the same complex as the Sales Offices--therefore the elevators were often tied up with salespeople and their prospective customers. As hot as it was at the time, this was definitely an inconvenience--there are stairs of course, but since my husband is physically challenged, this was not an option for him. On the plus side, the rooms were very spacious, well equipped with everything needed for preparing most any meal. A large table, and eight chairs and a bar area served our family well when having everyone together for a family meal. There was a whirlpool tub, and large vanity off the bedroom. The TVs were very nice and easy to operate, and there was a nice patio with chairs and tables. The baby pool was wonderful. In closing, we feel Gold Crown properties should offer the highest standard of cleanliness, friendliness, and service-we did not find this to be the case at this Wyndham property.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific condo”
Reviews.Author: twinksMo
Reviews.Content: These condos are spacious with terrific bathrooms, including a jaccuzi in the master suite. They are very clean and the furnishings are well kept. Televisions in both bedrooms and living room, including a dvd and vcr player.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at the FairField (Wyndham) Meadows, Branson Missouri”
Reviews.Author: Julia R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at the FairField (Wyndham) Meadows in Branson Missouri and once again, we had a wonderful time. Everything went smoothly and there were 16 people in our group. We had 4 units at this resort. The rooms were all nice and clean, well stocked with everything we needed for a week. We had 3 kids under the age of 10, a 12 year old, 2 13 year olds and a 17 year old with us and they all seemed to really enjoy themselves alot. The pools are very nice and well kept. We rented a pontoon and a speed boat out on table rock lake for a day, and it was so nice to be able to come back to a nice, clean unit and just walk down to the pools and hot tubs. The resort is very nicely located to the main stip, "76" and other attractions in the area, so we had only about a 10 minute car ride at the most. If you go and you want to have a fun time with your family, you have to go to McFarlands for a meal and ask at the front desk for the "rising table". It rises during your meal at the rate of 1 centimeter a minute, so it is very gradual. When our kids were told by their waiter that while they had been eating, the table had been rising, they really took a look and realized how high up the table was and realized they had been having difficulty reaching their food... may sound weird, but it was a lot of fun for us all.... Go and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: lawngirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Meadows in Branson, Mo. and have mixed reviews about the place. It was a very nice condo with nice furnishings. It was clean, but the carpet had been cleaned before our arrival and was saturated until the next night. I fell going into the kitchen due to the wet carpet that leads to the tile in the kitchen....... Also, we wanted to sleep after 6 a.m. but was unable due to the gas powered golf carts constantly running through the parking lot. We wondered why they couldn't afford the electric carts, which are much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Got to Go to Branson”
Reviews.Content: Fairfield Meadows units were spacious and clean and very well maintained. The best thing about this resort is its closness to the main drag. You do need a car but you are far enough away from the traffic that there is some peace and quiet. The resort offers nightly meals and entertainment at very reasonable prices so you don't even have to leave if you don't want to. But do take in a couple of shows while you are there. Two is all it takes as the jokes tend to repeat themselves after two shows. (check out deals on free tickets and discounted prices. They are ligit) Check out brand new Branson Landing with its terrific shopping and water/light show (go at night). Also Hard Luck Cafe (glad I read trip advisor reviews on this before we left) restaurant is well worth the trip. It is in the Branson Village by the Christmas shops. The waiters & waitresses all take turns singing in between serving. They are all terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairfield!”
Reviews.Author: savanahsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fairfield at the Meadows from July 6th-9th. We had a wonderful time. This place was just so fabulous. The condos are unbelievable. So roomy and everything you could possibly need is right there. The entire staff was very friendly and would go out of their way for whatever you would need. They also had a man in a golf cart to take you around wherever you needed to go. His name was Gail and he was really great. I would reccomend this place to anyone who could afford it. We stayed on some friends points so we didn't have to do any timeshare stuff. It is just an all around great place!

Reviews.Title: “Just about Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Eagle_Baseball_Wife
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at the Fairfield Branson Meadows. The condo's are always nice and clean and there is plenty of room in the One bedroom deluxe we stayed in this time. Our two boys slept on the pull out couch after taking a long bubble bath in the huge whirlpool tub. The view from the balcony was very pretty with a flowing stream right below us and a waterfall just up the stream (see picture) The washer and dryer is great to wash your clothes before you leave or while you stay. We always go to the store to buy food, they have everything you need to cook a meal. You will not be dissapointed in this resort and you can find great deals on the internet most of the time cheaper then a small hotel room. The boys also loved playing in the large kiddy pool and playing in the game room. We will be staying at the Fairfield Mt. Vista this weekend and we hear it is even nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: SDtravel0025
Reviews.Content: Spent some rainy, cool days at this resort, but the rooms at this resort made the stay worthwhile. All the comforts of home, with a luxury bath and beautiful view out the balcony. The exercise room was of gym quality, with daily activities right at the resort. The only problem was the indoor pool was not heated, so we spent our time in outdoor hot tub. Would definitely stay again if I travel to Branson again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Timeshare Condos in Branson”
Reviews.Author: JeepLover
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Branson during their early preseason. This is strictly a review of Fairfield at the Meadows and we are not familiar with the other properties there. This is important too because visitors are not supposed to use the facilities at the other Fairfield Resorts but if you are staying at the Meadows they have everything one could want. Our main reason for coming was that we had gotten a discount package to tour a Grand Crowne resort (separate review) which didn’t hold a candle to Fairfield. We decided to add on a couple of days at Fairfield to use up some leftover points. As we arrived we noticed that the place was beautiful as usual. Even though it is still technically winter, Fairfield took advantage of the unseasonably warm weather to plant many beautiful flowers and have their fountains and streams up and running. On our way into the check-in area we were made to feel like royalty with instant service, super friendly attitude and copies of their activities schedule for the week and our room key of course. We were told that they had just won Fairfield’s “Pineapple” award. We took the elevator to our 4th floor 1 bedroom deluxe-A room near one end of the building. “Deluxe” means it includes a whirlpool tub for two. The room turned out to be a handicapped room which means it had low closet hangers and shelves and a special shower as well as a lower kitchen counter. A separate countertop microwave is available if needed. Everything was very spacious and I would count it as 4 distinct rooms: Kitchen, living room, bedroom and large bathroom for the two of us. We were each even given a check-in bundle which included, a razor, shave cream, tooth paste and brush, etc., etc. and a chocolate turtle candy (too bad my wife doesn’t like nuts but I sure do.) I found nothing wrong with the room although my wife thought the water smelled stinky and she noticed a few dirty cups in the cupboard. It probably would have been better to have at least asked us if we would prefer a regular room since my wife did find it difficult to wash her hair in the handicapped shower. A couple of lights went out at different times which might have been related to the storm. I thought there ought to be a bathroom light switch that could be turned on from the bedroom but all of the light switches were on the bathroom wall by the door from the living room. It wasn’t a real problem at night because the light on the side of the wall mounted hair drier served as a night light so you could find the switches by the other door but a three way switch would have been a nice touch. From our deck we could see the lighted fountain as well as the brook running between the buildings. Since it was rather slow, I don’t think anyone was directly across from us but it did seem a bit close if there had been anyone there. All of the services are found in centrally located separate buildings. There was the registration building which probably also offered tickets for sale (who doesn’t in Branson). Then there was a separate Member Services building where we talked with our coordinator. Then there was a main staffed recreation building which had the indoor pool, game room, exercise equipment and outdoor shuffle board. The outdoor pool and hot tub were still covered and there was another outdoor building probably for seeing preview shows in warmer weather. We weren’t in any hurry to see the shows since we knew we would receive some free tickets from the time share tour at the other resort. I decided to enter the pool tournament which was fun even though I didn’t win. The next day the weather was so warm that we decided to go hiking on the other side of the dam. Later we went to a show and when we got back to our room, there was a message that we were under a tornado watch. We turned on the TV and got an update about the time the local siren went off and there was another call from the front desk advising us of the tornado warning and where to go to take cover. Fortunately the storm missed us. For attending a “survey” session, we were given a $30 coupon towards dinner at the Chateau on the Lake which we took advantage of on our last night. The survey is a “soft sell” but we were happy to be assigned a regular coordinator whom we can contact with program and other questions. We actually made a second appointment because we still had questions and they were all very graciously answered by Nic. Most of the “Big Name” shows had not opened for the season yet so if you really want to see those, it is best to wait until April or May. But there are so many shows to see in Branson that we had no trouble finding great shows that we had never seen before. But the best part is that there was almost no difficulty getting up and down Country 76 (“the strip”). There was also no need to make reservations or buy tickets way in advance in order to get great seats. Branson was just a whole lot more “laid back” in March than during the prime Summer season, or Thanksgiving or Christmas. But if you do want more show choices, try to arrange your stay during the week and avoid the prime time weekends.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AngieHu
Reviews.Content: We visited Branson (Fairfield at the Meadows) in January not realizing most shows and many restaurants are closed for the season (reopen in late March). But we did not lack things to do. The resort activity center had so much fun stuff for our 3-yo and us, plus the pool and the shopping (cheapest time of the year at the outlet malls), we had a blast. The resort is clean, and for the record the mattress is firm and supportive. Staffs are nice too. It was so comfortable we stayed one extra day! All this good review from a family used to stay in our own homes (we have a primary and a second home), not bad. The only downside is the lack in Wi-Fi signal strength in the unit. The resort had Wi-Fi computers but limits to 15min and has no sound. Carpet is a bit old too.

Reviews.Title: “3 words, AWESOME,AWESOME,AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: hkymom68
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there for 3 nights, and loved every minute of it. We had a 2 bed/2 bath unit, in Bldg. 7, on the 4th floor. It was an amazing unit, very clean and very spacious. We had our 2 boys, 7 and 5, and they loved the Rec center. It had a game room, indoor pool, shuffleboard, basketball court, and the hot tub and outdoor pool were still open. We enjoyed the hot tub quite a bit. The boys got to participate in a good game of "HORSE" at the basketball court, with a nice little reward at the end of popcorn, soda, and a movie rental. All we had to do was call the front desk and they would send a golf cart to come pick us up and take us to the Rec center. My boys got to know the great golf cart driver, BJ, and every evening he wouid expect us. He'd gave the kids candy every night when he dropped us off. The staff was AMAZING!! Everything we asked for they did. We stayed there on some timeshare points of a friend, and I never would buy a timeshare, but if I did it would be there. We are hopefully going to rent there next year again. I highly recomment this complex.

Reviews.Title: “Its A Gold Mine”
Reviews.Author: bruceoreo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meadows for a week and it was wonderful. The staff is incredible, the grounds are beautiful, and the daily activities schedule is very convenient for those that may just want to hang around the resort. This resort makes your stay worth while! The rooms are very spacious and everything you would need is already there for you. I would highly recommend this resort as your place to stay. You won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Great!”
Reviews.Author: wincha
Reviews.Content: I can not understand the great reviews of this place. I do have to say the staff are very nice. The Beach Party Show was great. We were put on the Meadowbrook "owner" side. The bathrooms were filthy. Dead and LIVE bugs in the shower and bathtub. Stool on the toilet. TV's are cheap, DVD barely worked. Master bed mattress old and saggy very uncomfortable. Website shows 2 beds in 2nd bedroom and we get one for my kids to share. The pool is dangerous. They have 2 pools that have these 3 steps and waterfall in between with a "watch your step" sign. Accidents just waiting to happen. Not to handicapped friendly either. It was nice they had plenty of activities to do. We will either go back to the Horizons, Big Cedar, or Chateau on the Lake. I would not go back to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “great, new resort”
Reviews.Author: texas1225
Reviews.Content: this resort was very clean, new and nice. we were very pleased. the rooms were big and everything was new. we stayed at the mountain vista area. it is really close to the driving headaches - the main strip of branson- we loved this area, and are hoping to return at christmas time. we were pleased with every show, ride, and tour we took. the only two downfalls of the resort are the pools, and the insulation. my five year old and her daddy said we have elephants living upstairs. they were coming and going all night long. we could not believe such a nice place would not have been insulation. the pools were also a bummer, because they were so crowded. for the size of the resort, they needed about 5 pools.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with the Meadows!”
Reviews.Author: okcmenace
Reviews.Content: We rented a two bedroom timeshare/condo for two nights over Memorial Day weekend. The room was better than expected. We had three adults and three children and there was plenty of room to spread out. One room had a king size bed and the other bedroom had two full size beds, plus there was the sofa bed if needed. We cooked all of our meals in the room as the kitchen was well equipped and it saved us a ton of money feeding that many people. We had three televisions as well as a dvd/vcr combo and cd player. The master bedroom also had a huge jacuzzi. The kids loved the pool and the recreation room provided. You can't go wrong with the Meadows! We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gitano
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean, big suite, affordable, no complaints, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fairfield meadows was a very nice place for our weekend getaway. We rented the 2 bedroom. The condo was very clean, and well equiped for all of our needs - the property was very nice and had plenty of activities to choose from> The staff was excellent and very friendly. We will definatly return here - we travel to Branson 3-4 times per year. Thanks Fairfield for the great Condo experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pleaseant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairfield Branson at the Meadow for one night on Dec. 10, 2004. Overall we had good and comfortable stay. We had a two-bed room lodge and it was clean and neat to our satisfaction. The master bedroom had two-person sized Jacuzzi tub that was nice. We were able to park directly outside of our first floor lodge. The only quarrels we had were the 4 PM check policy was etched in stone. So, don't show up at 3:30 PM, your room will NOT be available. They also required you to strip the beds of the used sheets and collect all the used towel. These are things that typically taken care of at a normal hotel stay. All in all, we WILL return to this resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Meadows this weeked and it was GREAT! It was very clean and the staff was very friendly. We brought our two boys and stayed in a one bedroom with a sleeper sofa. It is much nicer then staying in a Hotel. I was able to do laundry right in our room. It has a kitchen with dishwasher and everything you need to make a meal. We are going back in December and we will stay again. We have said good-bye to hotel living....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very impressed with the Branson Meadows condos. We had never stayed in a condo before, and we really enjoyed it. The condo was well decorated and had all the latest appliances. We rented a 2 bedroom, one of the bedrooms had a king bed and the other had 2 twin beds, perfect for our 2 kids. We enjoyed the 3 swimming pools and shuffleboard. I used the fitness center which I thought was equipped wtih state-of-the -art equipment. Branson Meadows was beautiful, waterfalls, foilage, and stone walkways. They also had excellent security. My only complaint was that we could hear the people above us, which kind of disturbed our sleep. I still would not hestitate to stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Wyndham Branson at The Meadows
HotelInfo.Address: 110 Willow Bend Drive, Branson, MO 65616 (Formerly Fairfield Branson at the Meadows)
